description: But now is the small image always loaded instead! Why is this? Sam makes a search on DuckDuckGo (Bigfoots are very serious about their privacy) and realizes that he's forgotten about something. He needs to tell the browser how wide the images are!
todo: Add the width after each image file name in the srcset. For example, if the image is 320 pixels wide, write "image.jpg 320w"

correct.headline: Yaay!
correct.text: It makes Sam very happy to see that the small image is loaded on small screens and the large one on large screens!

wrong.headline: It's not working...
wrong.text: Sam becomes disappointed when the wrong image is loaded.
